post.author: 부기흡
post.content:
Our own Kick Off Celebration!  Join us for our very own tribute to the recent
Launch of Visual Studio 2005!

MEETING ANNOUNCEMENT:
When? THURSDAY, November 17 , 6:00 p.m. - 9:00 p.m.
Where? Microsoft Canada , 1950 Meadowvale Blvd , Mississauga (north of 401 at
Mississauga Road exit)

How Do I Register?  http://www.torontoug.net - or call Ed Musters at
416-817-3330.
6:00 p.m. - Meet and greet! Arrive early! Prize give aways!! Food and drinks!!
6:30 p.m. - Opening Remarks
6:45 p.m. - Building Scalable Web Applications using Microsoft Visual Studio
2005:  Visual Studio 2005 and ASP.NET 2.0 combine to form a rich platform for
building, testing, and deploying state-of-the-art Web applications. ASP.NET 2.0
is replete with new features, from data source controls and master pages to
membership and role management services-features that reduce the amount of code
required to create a typical Web site by up to 70%. Visual Studio 2005 features
an all-new Web development interface that speeds the development process while
offering a rich design-time experience and seamless integration with Visual
Studio 2005 Team System. These products are second to none when it comes to
building scalable, high-performance, Web applications.
8:15 p.m. - Wrap up and Prizes!

IMPORTANT NOTE: This is a repeat session as was presented at the VS Launch Tour
on November 8!!

SPEAKER PROFILE:  
Luis Duran, UG Board Member


VERY IMPORTANT NOTE - BEFORE YOU REGISTER:
While the meetings are FREE to you, the meetings cost real money on the part of
our sponsors to put on, in the order of thousands of dollars.  When you
register, we are spending money on YOU, by reserving a place, and ordering food.
So please make your registration an absolute and unwavering commitment to
attend!

HOW TO REGISTER:
1.  We prefer you register on the web at http://www.torontoug.net
2.  PLEASE we need your registration if you are going to attend!  We need to
know how many will come so that we can book the appropriate number of event
rooms and order adequate food.  We are regularly selling out meetings with over
200 people attending, so be sure to register early!!
3.  If you are a member, please Login!  If you are not yet a member, click
"Register".  There is NO COST to join.
4.  If you have logged in or just signed up as a new member this DOES NOT
automatically sign you up for the event!
5.  Please go to the "User Group Events" section, and click on the "Read More"
to see the event details.  You will see the "Click here to register" link.
6.  If all else fails, please contact Ed Musters at 416-817-3330 and leave a
message.

The Toronto .NET User Group currently has over 3,000 registered members, making
it one of the largest in North America!  Thank you to all for your tremendous
support.

Ed Musters, President
Toronto .NET User Group
post.title: Launch of Visual Studio 2005
